body: The tests are green. Are there any outstanding issues, or are you ready to merge it in? Since it is a feature branch, presumably you can just roll forwards addressing any issues.

I plan to discuss with Manu about some topics tomorrow. I will do the merge. Thanks !

What is the use case for this change?

Some FileBasedSource authors may want to prevent splitting. A good example will be compressed sources where each file should be decompressed and fully read at a single worker.

PTAL.
LGTM. Thank you for the clarifications.

Thanks.

retest this please

R: @dhalperi verified with a DatastoreWordCount job that stats querying works now. Is there a way in integration tests to verify the number of splits generated (#elements generated by a PTransform)? It would help us catch any unknown Datastore behavior that we have missed in Unit tests.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

One thing I'm concerned about is potability - we're trying to avoid `SparkRunner.create().run()` in the pipeline, and use `Pipeline.run()` instead, which creates the `PipelineRunner` from the provided options.
This could prove tricky..
It's worth a shot to see if `SparkPipelineOptions` can accommodate the provided context, but please note it should be annotated with `@JsonIgnore`

@amitsela, I've made some changes following our review.

Let me know how it looks.

R: @aljoscha 
R: @mxm
Could we wait for this to go in after #737 went in? This changes basically everything and would make rebasing a horrible experience.
@aljoscha sorry, no problem.
Cool, thanks.
Just back from a little vacation. I'll take a further look.
Already discussed this with @jbonofre Thanks for delaying this a bit.
R: @dhalperi

It's tricky to review some of the changed parts because a lot of the files have been Checkstyle adjusted and renamed which makes them appear as completely new. After a second look I'm convinced that you did some really nice work here @aljoscha. Not only does it simplify a lot of the code but it also introduces a good abstraction to realize side inputs on top of Flink streaming which does not support side inputs natively. So +1 for merging from my side.
LGTM! (Not waiting for Travis since I saw Jenkins passed.)

LGTM from me too.

Normally I might wait for the touch-ups we've commented on, but since this PR is already huge and the comments are not critical, I think it is best to merge and roll forwards unless someone has an objection. I will go ahead and merge it after a short waiting period.
You'll notice in the history that it used to be `install`. The change was just to speed things up, skipping `jar` phases, etc.
R: @dhalperi

Just to clarify this prevents the download of maven-metadata.xml for the snapshots to check for any newer versions right? 
I think you also need this in the test_word.sh since that exec:java plugin is also tied to the verify phase and performs the same checks. 

The actual downloading of jars is still happening in every travis build when exec:java is run since we delete any cached beam jars. https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/.travis.yml#L52
Thanks, this is interesting!
That's a fast review. Will fix it tomorrow.
On behalf of the 10 +1s on the Beam dev list, LGTM and merged.

Currently the implementation requires the receiver of a KeyedWorkItem to extract the appropriate windows from that item - the Work Item contains either elements and their reified windows, or contains timers (which are in window-appropriate) namespaces, but need not contain only elements in a single window.
@kennknowles I thought so. The question is how often do we see connection issues? Maybe a good first step would be to just try "mvn dependency:resolve" at the beginning as @lukecwik suggested.
R: @dhalperi

LGTM

However, since we can do multiple exports, do we want to tie the partition size to the BQ limit?
For example, if the pipeline have 10TB data to export, is that faster to use one job or five jobs.
BigQuery perf is the same whether it's five jobs or one job, but fewer jobs require fewer workers polling them and also fewer quota-ridden RPCs to BigQuery's APIs.
Great!
R: @dhalperi

R: @aaltay Ahmet, Could you do an overall review of this PR ?

R: @dhalperi Dan, Could you review this focusing on logic for generating consumed and remaining number of split points (since you wrote the corresponding Java PR).

Thanks.

I discussed with Manu about couple of topics:
- support of some IO features (not yet implements, it's on the TODO)
- the README.md could be enhanced
- the translation of DoFn is based on Gearpump FlatMapFunction which matches well
- examples package and code directly in the runner (I would keep it like this for now and remove later)

I also tested the gearpump runner with the last gearpump incubating release with simple pipelines.

I also checked:
- checkstyle is OK
- headers are OK

@kennknowles I'm proposing to merge this runner on master. It would give more visibility and would allow people to experiment and provide feedback. If you agree, I will do more than happy to do the merge  ;)

Thanks for merging. I think it is always better to address comments before merging. Everything that is not addressed from my experience either never gets fixed or comes back in forms of bug reports which could be non-trivial to debug (e.g. empty catch block). That said, let me see if I can address the minor issues that we commented on :)
Thanks for the review @mxm and @kennknowles. I would quickly propose a follow up PR that also fixes some javadocs based on your comments.

@amitsela I moved the `sparkContext` to `SparkPipelineOptions`.
Do you see any other tests or edge cases that need to be tested ?

@amarouni I've added some comments, this looks good but I think a rebase (and probably a merge) is in place. Once Jenkins passes I'll take another look.
Thanks!

@amitsela I messed up my branch really bad ! A rebase would be like rewriting the whole thing. Good news is that I have it on another branch in my fork but I was wondering if I can delete my current branch and push a new update to date one. I don't know if this is possible on the same PR.
@staslev looking good, I had one final note, it's probably worth "kicking" Travis anyway..
#737 is in now so I think you can pick this up again.
@aljoscha Great ! Thanks a bunch. I'm updating accordingly.
LGTM, will merge once tests officially pass. Thanks!
R: @amitsela
LGTM.
@amitsela Thx, I'm waiting for end of Jenkins and Travis and I will merge. Thanks !
Looks good to me. Maybe logging a warning on non-deterministic coders would be helpful.
Rebased, and updated with latest changes. Let me know what you think about it guys. Thanks.

Hi @amarouni,

To overwrite/update an in-process PR, you can force-push to your branch on
GitHub; the PR will automatically be recalculated based on the new branch.

I do recommend that you read the Apache Beam contribution guide for more
information on our recommended code/review/iterate PR strategy.
http://beam.incubator.apache.org/contribute/contribution-guide/

On Thu, Aug 25, 2016 at 3:32 AM, amarouni notifications@github.com wrote:

> @amitsela https://github.com/amitsela I messed up my branch really bad
> ! A rebase would be like rewriting the whole thing. Good news is that I
> have it on another branch in my fork but I was wondering if I can delete my
> current branch and push a new update to date one. I don't know if this is
> possible on the same PR.
>

+1 on what Dan said. But if things still don't work for you, you can close this PR and open a new one.
This PR has been open for a while now and it was my fault for missing this.
My bad as well, I missed the last changed and forgot to work on it.
Turns out failures were due to a bad rebase. Latest version builds locally.
LGTM from my side. Maybe @mxm has some comments, though.
That's a different discussion for the mailing list, where we have discussed criteria a bit. This PR is merging the other way, so that the `gearpump-runner` branch is caught up to `master` a bit.

I have shuffled the commits for readability and pushed the changes from this PR into `gearpump-runner`. I think you'll need to close this PR manually due to the way the asfgit bot operates.

I recommend merging `master` into `gearpump-runner` as frequently as possible so that it is almost always a pretty small update.
PTAL

I want just to refer here a recent Jira issue talking about ProfilingOptions because this probably will be related in the future.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-588
@iemejia how's that relevant to the Python SDK ? I'm not too familiar with it.

To be honest I don't really know, maybe I just misinterpreted but since the issue name was:
"All runners should support ProfilingOptions" I supposed that it could be a new proposal or something that could be related.
